Camp of the 20" Regt Ky Vols
Before Atlanta G A
Aug 24th 1864
Gov Bramblet --
Sir

By request of some of the members of my Company, and to relieve myself of the annoyance of them, I write to you for information concerning the mustering out of Volunteers who Enlisted under a call you made on the State for 20000 Volunteers, to serve in old Regts, for a term of 12 months, being allowed $2500 Bounty and $200 provision, There is six of them in Company, they were told by the mustering Officer that they would have to ^be^ mustered in for three years as it was a three years Regt, but we assured that they would be discharged with the Regt, they are Reported as three years Volunteers, on all Rolls, and in the Company Books, and are
now told that they will have to serve three years, from date of Enlistment, You wil please do me the Kindnesss, to let me know whether they can be mustered out, with the Regt, or not, and if not, whether they will be entitled to the Bounty allowed three yrs volunteers, or not, by so doing, you will give great satisfaction, to some badly dissatisfied Soldiers, I wil not weary you with more on the subject, please excuse this,

Awaiting your Reply
Sir I have the honor to be
Your most Obt Servt
Samuel C. Plumlee
Sgt Co, Ky 20" Rgt Ky Vols
3d Brig, 2nd Div, 23rd A, C,

20
Camp 20" Ky Vols
Before Atlanta Ga
Aug 24" 1864 --
Plumlee Saml C.
Sgt Co, K, 20" Ky Vols --
To The Gov.
Asks if volunteers, under your call for 20000, to be assigned to old regts will be mustered out when the regt is, or will they have to serve three years from enlistment --
